metadata.title: Complete Seborrheic Dermatitis Harmful Ingredients Database - Part 1: Ingredients
metadata.description: Comprehensive, expanded database of chemical compounds and ingredients in hair/skincare products that exacerbate seborrheic dermatitis. Part 1 focuses on complete ingredient categorization with mechanisms.
metadata.disclaimer: This database is based on dermatological research, clinical studies, and published scientific literature. Individual reactions vary significantly. Always consult a dermatologist before using new products.
metadata.database_structure: This is PART 1 of 3. Part 1: Ingredients. Part 2: Analysis & Mechanisms. Part 3: Practical Applications.
metadata.research_basis: Based on studies by Prohic et al. (2016), Ro & Dawson (2005), Gupta et al. (2004), and modern lipid metabolism research

fatty_acids.category_description: Long-chain fatty acids (C12-C24) that serve as primary nutrient sources for Malassezia globosa and M. furfur overgrowth
fatty_acids.scientific_basis: Malassezia species possess lipase enzymes optimized for C11-C24 fatty acid metabolism. Shorter chains (C8-C10) and longer chains (>C24) are not metabolically accessible.

ingredients.name: Lauric Acid
ingredients.malassezia_affinity: EXTREMELY HIGH - Preferred substrate for lipase
ingredients.reason: C12 is optimal size for Malassezia lipase active site
ingredients.skin_effects: Immediate scalp inflammation (12-48h), increased sebum oxidation, accelerated barrier degradation

ingredients.name: Myristic Acid
ingredients.found_in_products: Palm oil, palm kernel, some butter blends

ingredients.name: Palmitic Acid
ingredients.prevalence: Found in ~80% of conventional hair products
ingredients.barrier_function_impact: Disrupts lipid lamellae organization in stratum corneum

ingredients.name: Stearic Acid
ingredients.mechanism: Malassezia lipase specifically recognizes C18 backbone structure
ingredients.inflammatory_marker: Increases IL-6 and TNF-alpha in keratinocytes

ingredients.name: Oleic Acid
ingredients.reason: Unsaturated C18; research shows exacerbates inflammatory response more than saturated C18
ingredients.oxidation_risk: Prone to lipid peroxidation; creates additional irritants
ingredients.research_citation: Studies show oleic acid increases TSLP (thymic stromal lymphopoietin) expression

ingredients.name: Linoleic Acid
ingredients.paradox: Essential for skin but problematic in SD-prone skin (immune dysregulation)
ingredients.barrier_effect: Natural component of skin barrier, but oxidized forms (from yeast metabolism) trigger immune response

ingredients.name: Arachidic Acid
ingredients.malassezia_affinity: HIGH - Within substrate range but slower metabolism than C12-C18

ingredients.name: Ricinoleic Acid
ingredients.unique_property: Hydroxyl group (-OH) on position 12 increases keratinocyte irritation independent of Malassezia
ingredients.dual_risk: Both as yeast nutrient AND direct irritant
ingredients.skin_penetration: Higher percutaneous absorption than typical fatty acids

ingredients.name: Caprylic Acid
ingredients.reason: Chain length <C11 outside Malassezia lipase substrate specificity
ingredients.safety_evidence: Safe; often recommended in clinical SD protocols
ingredients.additional_benefit: May have mild antifungal properties against Malassezia

ingredients.name: Behenic Acid
ingredients.barrier_effect: Ultra-long chain causes significant barrier disruption

lipids_and_oils.category_description: Complete lipid and oil database with detailed composition analysis
lipids_and_oils.selection_criteria: Only oils with C8-C10 dominant composition are safe

ingredients.name: Coconut Oil
ingredients.why_problematic: 47% lauric acid (C12) is optimal Malassezia substrate. Combined with myristic acid creates perfect feeding formula.
ingredients.reaction_timeline: SD flare typically 6-48 hours after application
ingredients.marketing_deception: Often marketed as 'natural' or 'organic' without warning about SD contraindication
ingredients.scalp_effects: Intense itching, sebum oxidation, smell production, inflammation

ingredients.name: Olive Oil
ingredients.mechanism: High oleic acid content; oxidizes easily when applied to scalp
ingredients.oxidation_products: Creates lipid peroxides, causing additional inflammation beyond Malassezia feeding

ingredients.name: Argan Oil
ingredients.marketing_note: Heavily marketed as 'luxury' product; no SD-safe formulation
ingredients.affordability_trap: Premium price doesn't protect SD-prone skin

ingredients.name: Jojoba Oil
ingredients.unique_property: Contains wax esters (not true triglycerides); similar to sebum structure
ingredients.problem: Long-chain eicosenoic acid (C20) still accessible to Malassezia
ingredients.barrier_effect: Occlusive; traps heat and yeast byproducts

ingredients.name: Avocado Oil
ingredients.additional_risk: Contains phytosterols that may stimulate IL-17 pathway in SD-prone skin

ingredients.name: Shea Butter
ingredients.form: Solid at room temperature; blocks scalp airflow
ingredients.thermal_effect: Traps heat on scalp - increases yeast metabolism

ingredients.name: Castor Oil
ingredients.dual_problem: Both Malassezia substrate AND direct keratinocyte irritant (due to hydroxyl group)
ingredients.viscosity: Extremely occlusive; forms seal on scalp

ingredients.name: MCT Oil
ingredients.mechanism: Malassezia lipase cannot access C8-C10 chains
ingredients.additional_benefit: May have mild antifungal effect through short-chain fatty acid metabolism in normal skin
ingredients.usage_note: Only true 'safe' fatty acid source for SD-prone skin

esters_comprehensive.category_description: Extended database of ester compounds that Malassezia lipases can hydrolyze into problematic free fatty acids
esters_comprehensive.mechanism_explanation: Malassezia secretes extracellular lipases that cleave ester bonds, releasing free fatty acids. Even if ester itself is inert, hydrolysis products feed yeast.
esters_comprehensive.hydrolysis_rate: Varies by enzyme concentration and ester structure; typically 2-8 hours on scalp

ingredients.name: Isopropyl Palmitate
ingredients.prevalence: Found in 60%+ of conventional moisturizers and leave-in products
ingredients.additional_concern: Isopropanol component can further disrupt barrier

ingredients.name: Decyl Oleate
ingredients.malassezia_affinity: EXTREMELY HIGH - Oleic acid is preferred substrate

ingredients.name: Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride
ingredients.mechanism: Even if hydrolyzed, C8-C10 products cannot be metabolized by Malassezia

ingredients.name: Dicaprylyl Ether
ingredients.structure: Ether linkage (not ester); resistant to lipase
ingredients.reason: Not substrate for lipase hydrolysis; MCT-derived

ingredients.name: Propylene Glycol Dicaprylate/Dicaprate
ingredients.note: Safe fatty acid portion; propylene glycol component slightly problematic

ingredients.name: Myristyl Laurate
ingredients.potency: Double hit - both hydrolysis products are highly problematic

galactomyces_ferments_expanded.category_description: Yeast fermentation products that stimulate Aryl Hydrocarbon Receptor (AhR), exacerbating Malassezia-driven inflammation
galactomyces_ferments_expanded.mechanism: AhR activation → IL-22 production → barrier dysfunction + immune dysregulation in SD-prone skin
galactomyces_ferments_expanded.research_basis: Malassezia-infected skin shows 3-4x elevated AhR signaling. Galactomyces ferments amplify this.

ingredients.name: Galactomyces Fermentation Filtrate
ingredients.mechanism: Produces β-glucans and polysaccharides that bind Pattern Recognition Receptors (PRRs), activating innate immunity
ingredients.sd_outcome: Severe flare within 24-48 hours; lasting inflammation 7-14 days
ingredients.why_popular: Popular in K-beauty brands (Missha, Cosrx, others) - MAJOR TRAP for SD sufferers

ingredients.name: Saccharomyces Fermentation Filtrate
ingredients.mechanism: Similar to Galactomyces but slightly less potent

ingredients.name: Bifida Fermentation Lysate
ingredients.paradox: Probiotics normally beneficial, but Bifida fermentation products trigger immune response in SD-prone skin
ingredients.mechanism: Lipopolysaccharide (LPS) from cell wall activation of TLR4 pathway
ingredients.reasoning: Even dead cells contain immunogenic epitopes

ingredients.name: Rice Ferment Filtrate
ingredients.inci: Rice Ferment Filtrate / Rice Fermentation Filtrate
ingredients.mechanism: Fermentation byproducts (acetaldehyde, ethanol) irritate barrier
ingredients.products_common: Asian beauty hydrating toners, essence products

ingredients.name: Lactobacillus Fermentation Products
ingredients.reason: Least inflammatory ferment; lactic acid production may even be mildly beneficial
ingredients.caveat: Still elevated risk compared to non-fermented ingredients

ingredients.name: Aspergillus Fermentation Products
ingredients.concern: Aspergillus spores may be contaminated; immunogenic

ingredients.name: Yeast Extract (Unspecified)
ingredients.recommendation: AVOID - Impossible to assess safety without species identification

high_sensitivity_ingredients_expanded.category_description: Chemical irritants, allergens, and barrier-disrupting agents that trigger contact dermatitis in SD-prone skin
high_sensitivity_ingredients_expanded.cumulative_effect: Multiple sensitizers in one product = exponential irritation

ingredients.name: Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS)
ingredients.inci: Sodium Lauryl Sulfate / SDS / Dodecyl Sulfate
ingredients.mechanism: Protein denaturant; directly damages cell membranes
ingredients.skin_disruption: Removes 30-40% of skin lipids within single wash
ingredients.sd_specific_effect: Removes protective lipids; exposes Malassezia overgrowth patches
ingredients.products_commonly_found: Budget shampoos, dandruff shampoos (paradoxically), baby products

ingredients.name: Sodium Laureth Sulfate (SLES)
ingredients.inci: Sodium Laureth Sulfate / Sodium Lauryl Ether Sulfate
ingredients.mechanism: Slightly gentler than SLS but still highly damaging
ingredients.skin_effect: Same barrier disruption as SLS, plus potential carcinogenic exposure

ingredients.name: Sodium Chloride (Salt)
ingredients.inci: Sodium Chloride / Sea Salt / Himalayan Salt
ingredients.mechanism: Osmotic dehydration of stratum corneum

ingredients.name: Synthetic Fragrances
ingredients.oxidation_products: Limonene oxidizes on skin → oxidized limonene (OxLim) = contact allergen
ingredients.concentration_deception: Even 0.1% fragrance can trigger SD in sensitive individuals

ingredients.name: Parabens
ingredients.mechanism: Endocrine disruptors; mimic estrogen
ingredients.skin_effect: Contact allergic dermatitis in 1-8% of population; higher in SD-prone
ingredients.molecular_mimicry: Bind estrogen receptors on keratinocytes → inflammatory signaling
ingredients.penetration: Easily absorbed through damaged SD-prone barriers
ingredients.cumulative_effect: Multiple paraben types in product = additive estrogenic effect

ingredients.name: Formaldehyde & Formaldehyde-Releasing Agents
ingredients.inci: Formaldehyde, DMDM Hydantoin, Quaternium-15, Imidazolidinyl Urea, Diazolidinyl Urea
ingredients.mechanism: Known carcinogen; releases free formaldehyde over product shelf life
ingredients.skin_effect: Severe protein cross-linking; allergic contact dermatitis
ingredients.sd_specific_danger: Oxidative stress amplifies Malassezia immune dysregulation

ingredients.name: Phenoxyethanol
ingredients.mechanism: Mild antimicrobial; sensitizing to 0.5-1% in formulations
ingredients.skin_effect: Contact dermatitis in 2-5% of sensitive individuals

ingredients.name: Propylene Glycol
ingredients.mechanism: Enhances percutaneous penetration of other irritants (1.5-2x)
ingredients.synergistic_effect: Makes other problematic ingredients 50-100% MORE irritating
ingredients.skin_reaction: Sensitization at 20-50%; irritation at 2-5% in sensitive skin
ingredients.sd_issue: Increased penetration of fatty acids into stratum corneum

ingredients.name: Alcohol (Ethanol, Isopropyl)
ingredients.inci: Ethanol, Ethyl Alcohol, Isopropyl Alcohol, SD Alcohol 40
ingredients.mechanism: Volatilizes on skin → immediate dehydration

ingredients.name: Silicones
ingredients.inci: Dimethicone, Cyclopentasiloxane, Amodimethicone, Cyclomethicone, Cyclic siloxanes
ingredients.mechanism: Occlusive barrier; traps moisture AND yeast byproducts
ingredients.buildup: Accumulates on scalp with each application; doesn't wash out completely
ingredients.microbe_trap: Creates anaerobic microenvironment promoting yeast overgrowth

ingredients.name: Mineral Oil / Petrolatum
ingredients.inci: Mineral Oil, Petrolatum, Liquid Paraffin, Paraffinum Liquidum
ingredients.mechanism: Petroleum-derived; forms occlusive barrier
ingredients.microbiome_effect: Traps heat and moisture; increases Malassezia growth 300-400%
ingredients.biocompatibility: Foreign to skin lipid structure; impairs normal barrier function

ingredients.name: PEG Compounds
ingredients.inci: PEG-1, PEG-4, PEG-6, PEG-8, PEG-20, PEG-40, PEG-75, PEG-100, etc.
ingredients.mechanism: Manufacturing contamination with ethylene oxide and 1,4-dioxane

ingredients.name: Polysorbates
ingredients.derivation: All derived from C12-C24 fatty acids
ingredients.mechanism: Hydrolyzable into problematic fatty acids + barrier disruption
ingredients.hydrolysis_rate: Slower than ester hydrolysis but still significant

ingredients.name: Synthetic Colors / FD&C Dyes
ingredients.inci: FD&C Blue No. 1, FD&C Red No. 40, FD&C Yellow No. 5, D&C Red No. 33, etc.

ingredients.name: Cocamidopropyl Betaine
ingredients.skin_effect: Scalp irritation, contact dermatitis in sensitive individuals
ingredients.contamination_risk: Often contaminated with 3-DMAPM (impurity causing allergic contact dermatitis)

ingredients.name: Cocamide DEA / MEA
ingredients.mechanism: Can form carcinogenic nitrosamines (N-nitrosodiethanolamine)
ingredients.formation_risk: Especially if product pH >7 or contaminated with nitrite

ingredients.name: Triclosan
ingredients.mechanism: Endocrine disruptor; thyroid and estrogen pathway disruptor
ingredients.microbiome_effect: Kills beneficial bacteria while Malassezia is resistant

ingredients.name: Essential Oils
ingredients.inci: Tea Tree Oil, Lavender Oil, Eucalyptus Oil, Peppermint Oil, Rosemary Oil, Lemongrass, Frankincense, etc.
ingredients.mechanism: Contain potent allergens: limonene, linalool, citronellol, eugenol
ingredients.marketing_deception: 'Natural' does not mean safe for SD
ingredients.oxidation_products: Oxidized monoterpenes (limonene oxide, linalool oxide) are contact allergens
ingredients.sd_specific_danger: Essential oils increase scalp pH → promotes Malassezia growth

ingredients.name: EDTA
ingredients.inci: Disodium EDTA, Tetrasodium EDTA, Tripotassium EDTA
ingredients.mechanism: Chelates skin minerals (Ca, Mg, Zn); disrupts barrier proteins

ingredients.name: Sodium Benzoate
ingredients.concern: Can produce benzene (carcinogen) when combined with ascorbic acid (Vitamin C) or when exposed to heat/light

polysorbates_expanded.category_description: All polysorbate emulsifiers - derived from C12-C24 fatty acids - with detailed breakdown
polysorbates_expanded.general_mechanism: Polysorbates are polyoxyethylene sorbitan esters derived from sorbitol + fatty acids. Malassezia lipases readily hydrolyze these to release free fatty acids.

ingredients.name: Polysorbate 20
ingredients.prevalence: Found in 40%+ of commercial skincare products

ingredients.name: Polysorbate 80
ingredients.hydrolysis_product: Oleic Acid (C18) - UNSATURATED; HIGH INFLAMMATORY POTENTIAL
ingredients.reason: Most commonly used polysorbate; Oleic acid particularly problematic

safe_alternatives_comprehensive.category_description: Ingredients confirmed SAFE for seborrheic dermatitis with evidence
safe_alternatives_comprehensive.disclaimer: Even 'safe' ingredients require patch testing. Concentration matters. Individual sensitivity varies.

fatty_acids_safe.name: Caprylic Acid (C8)
fatty_acids_safe.malassezia_metabolic_access: IMPOSSIBLE - Outside Malassezia lipase substrate range
fatty_acids_safe.evidence: Included in clinical dermatology SD protocols
fatty_acids_safe.benefits: Lightweight, hydrating, may have mild antifungal properties

oils_safe.name: MCT Oil
oils_safe.alternative_names: Fractionated coconut oil, MCT oil, Medium-chain triglyceride oil
oils_safe.usage_note: ONLY truly safe oil for SD-prone scalp

cleansers_safe.name: Plant-derived Non-Sulfate Cleansers
cleansers_safe.mechanism: Gentler surfactants; less barrier disruption than sulfates
cleansers_safe.note: Still require patch testing; some individuals sensitive

preservatives_safe.name: Sodium Benzoate (Isolated)
preservatives_safe.caution: Avoid if combined with ascorbic acid (benzene formation risk)
